docs.lead_paragraph: White Plains Hospital Center has begun a bariatric surgery program to help morbidly obese people lose weight. The program, the first of its kind at a hospital in Westchester, features vertical-banded gastroplasty, a surgical procedure that reduces the size of the stomach. Obesity is the major health problem in the nation, said Dr. William P. Homan, a surgeon at the hospital, explaining that the condition predisposes people to diabetes, stroke, hypertension, heart attacks, certain kinds of cancer and arthritis of the hips and knees.
